location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 19 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter outlines Persian efforts to expel Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, from Bundar Abbass [Bandar-e ʻAbbās] and Kishm [Qeshm]. These efforts include enlisting the services of Sooltan bin Suggur [Sulṭān bin Saqr]. It provides intelligence concerning two messagers that Zackee Khan has sent to both the Imam of Muscat and Sooltan bin Suggur respectively. It notes that these recent developments have alarmed the Imam.
